metadata.title: CVE-2018-16865 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
An allocation of memory without limits, that could result in the stackclashing with another memory region, was discovered in systemd-journaldwhen many entries are sent to the journal socket. A local attacker, or aremote one if systemd-journal-remote is used, may use this flaw to crashsystemd-journald or execute code with journald privileges. Versions throughv240 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.15
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.15').
